title: Ticket #752: User command to force DeferralTime job to run immediately
description:
(Based on a report by Scot Kronenfeld for the VDT.)

I'd like the ability to force a job to run NOW, and then continue on the normal schedule. I don't know how many people would use this, but in the context of RSV, this would be a very useful addition. Maybe it's already possible, but if so, I don't know how.
remarks:
2009-Sep-22 11:51:43 by adesmet:
(Based on a report from Alain Roy)

It's easy to imagine solutions that are easy from Condor's perspective. For example, it's easy to run a cron job "now" but editing a submit file and re-submitting it, but from the context of a system administrator it would be really nice to say "condor_cron_run_job_now <job-id>" and watch it run again. In order to get people to accept Condor cron, we want to make it as simple as possible to use.
